briefTitle: Compare the Clinical Efficacy of Prototype Toothpastes

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Male or female volunteers 18-65 years of age.
* Good general health.
* Must sign informed consent form.
* Minimum of 20 natural uncrowned teeth (excluding third molars) must be present.
* No history of allergy to personal care consumer products, or their ingredients, relevant to any ingredient in the test products as determined by the dental/medical professional monitoring the study.

Exclusion Criteria:

* Subject unable or unwilling to sign the informed consent form.
* Medical condition which requires pre-medication prior to dental visits/procedures.
* Moderate or advanced periodontal disease.
* 5 or more decayed untreated dental sites at screening.
* Other disease of the hard or soft oral tissues.
* Impaired salivary function (e.g. Sjogren's syndrome or head and neck irradiation).
* Use of medications that currently affect salivary flow.
* Use of antibiotics or antimicrobial drugs within 30 days prior to study visit #1.
* Pregnant or nursing women.
* Participation in any other clinical study within 1 week prior to enrollment into this study.
* Use of tobacco products.
* Subjects who must receive dental treatment during the study dates.
* Current use of Antibiotics for any purpose.
* Presence of an orthodontic appliance.
* History of allergy to common dentifrice ingredients.
* History of allergy to zinc.
* Immune compromised individuals (HIV, AIDS, immuno suppressive drug therapy).

outcomeMeasures.title: Plaque Index
outcomeMeasures.description: Plaque Index score scale 0 to 5 (0 = no plaque, 1 = separate flecks of plaque on the tooth, 2 = a thin continuous band of plaque,3 = a band of plaque up to one-third of the tooth, 4 = plaque covering up to two thirds of the of the tooth, 5 = plaque covering two-thirds or more of the crown of the tooth)

outcomeMeasures.title: Gingivitis Index
outcomeMeasures.description: Gingivitis score- scale 0 to 3 (0 = no inflammation,1 = Mild inflammation-slight change in color and little change in texture 2 = Moderate inflammation-moderate glazing, redness, edema and hypertrophy. Tendency to bleed upon probing. 3 = Severe inflammation-marked redness and hypertrophy. Tendency to spontaneous bleeding)
